nodes.documentation:
@title Group Selection
 @notice The group selection protocol is an interactive method of selecting
 candidate group from the set of all stakers given a pseudorandom seed value.

/// The protocol produces a representative result, where each staker's profit is
 proportional to the number of tokens they have staked. Produced candidate
 groups are of constant size.

/// Group selection protocol accepts seed as an input - a pseudorandom value
 used to construct candidate tickets. Each candidate group member can
 submit their tickets. The maximum number of tickets one can submit depends
 on their staking weight - relation of the minimum stake to the candidate's
 stake.

/// There is a certain timeout, expressed in blocks, when tickets can be
 submitted. Each ticket is a mix of staker's address, virtual staker index
 and group selection seed. Candidate group members are selected based on
 the best tickets submitted. There has to be a minimum number of tickets
 submitted, equal to the candidate group size so that the protocol can
 complete successfully.
nodes.name: GroupSelection
start

nodes.documentation:
@notice Finishes group selection protocol clearing up all the submitted
 tickets. This function may be expensive if not executed as a part of
 another transaction consuming a lot of gas and as a result, getting
 gas refund for clearing up the storage.
nodes.name: finish
submitTicket
submitTicket

nodes.documentation: @notice Performs full verification of the ticket.
nodes.name: isTicketValid

nodes.name: findReplacementIndex

nodes.name: selectedParticipants

nodes.documentation: @notice Clears up data of the group selection tickets.
nodes.name: cleanupTickets

nodes.documentation:
@notice Clears up data of the group selection candidates.
 This operation may have a significant cost if not executed as a part of
 another transaction consuming a lot of gas and as a result, getting
 gas refund for clearing up the storage.
nodes.name: cleanupCandidates

/// Group selection protocol accepts seed as an input - a pseudorandom value

/// There is a certain timeout, expressed in blocks, when tickets can be
 submitted. Each ticket is a mix of staker's address, virtual staker index
 and group selection seed. Candidate group members are selected based on
 the best tickets submitted. There has to be a minimum number of tickets
 submitted, equal to the candidate group size so that the protocol can

attributes.documentation:
@notice Clears up data of the group selection candidates.
 This operation may have a significant cost if not executed as a part of
 another transaction consuming a lot of gas and as a result, getting
 gas refund for clearing up the storage.
attributes.name: cleanupCandidates

params._seed: pseudorandom seed value used as an input for the group selection. All submitted tickets needs to have the seed mixed-in into the value.

params.stakingWeight: Ratio of the minimum stake to the candidate's stake.
params.ticket: Bytes representation of a ticket that holds the following: - ticketValue: first 8 bytes of a result of keccak256 cryptography hash   function on the combination of the group selection seed (previous   beacon output), staker-specific value (address) and virtual staker index. - stakerValue: a staker-specific value which is the address of the staker. - virtualStakerIndex: 4-bytes number within a range of 1 to staker's weight;   has to be unique for all tickets submitted by the given staker for the   current candidate group selection.

params.stakerValue: Staker-specific value which is the address of the staker.
params.stakingWeight: Ratio of the minimum stake to the candidate's stake.
params.ticketValue: First 8 bytes of a result of keccak256 cryptography hash function on the combination of the group selection seed (previous beacon output), staker-specific value (address) and virtual staker index.
params.virtualStakerIndex: 4-bytes number within a range of 1 to staker's weight; has to be unique for all tickets submitted by the given staker for the current candidate group selection.

finish(GroupSelection.Storage storage).notice: Finishes group selection protocol clearing up all the submitted tickets. This function may be expensive if not executed as a part of another transaction consuming a lot of gas and as a result, getting gas refund for clearing up the storage.

selectedParticipants(GroupSelection.Stor.notice: Gets selected participants in ascending order of their tickets.

submitTicket(GroupSelection.Storage stor.notice: Submits ticket to request to participate in a new candidate group.
Submits ticket to request to participate in a new candidate group.

userdoc.notice: The group selection protocol is an interactive method of selecting candidate group from the set of all stakers given a pseudorandom seed value.  /// The protocol produces a representative result, where each staker's profit is proportional to the number of tokens they have staked. Produced candidate groups are of constant size.  /// Group selection protocol accepts seed as an input - a pseudorandom value used to construct candidate tickets. Each candidate group member can submit their tickets. The maximum number of tickets one can submit depends on their staking weight - relation of the minimum stake to the candidate's stake.  /// There is a certain timeout, expressed in blocks, when tickets can be submitted. Each ticket is a mix of staker's address, virtual staker index and group selection seed. Candidate group members are selected based on the best tickets submitted. There has to be a minimum number of tickets submitted, equal to the candidate group size so that the protocol can complete successfully.
